public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (amount > 0) {
if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0){
if (!takeAsNote) {
if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot]+1]) {
if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot]-1),amount)) {
bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
resetBank();
resetItems(5064);
}

There.[/quote]

Thank you :], you own

if (amount > 0) {

item.title: Need help on client.java error
item.dc:creator: @n0va_k0 n0va k0
item.description:
@n0va_k0 wrote:

I have a problem and I don’t know what to do. I am still new with servers :. On my command prompt after i compiled it said:
client.java:11999: illegal start of expression
public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

There is a “^” under the p in public. Can anyone help me on what i should do? On my client.java it looks a bit like this

}
else if(muted == 1) {
sendMessage(“Yu r muted nd u cannot yell!”);
}
}
}
public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (amount > 0) {
if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0){
if (!takeAsNote) {
if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot]+1]) {
if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot]-1),amount)) {
bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
resetBank();
resetItems(5064);
}
